definition: variant of 噼裡啪啦|噼里啪啦[pi1 li5 pa1 la1]
to hack/to chop/to split open/(of lightning) to strike

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
sentence-final particle, contraction of 了啊, indicating exclamation/particle placed after each item in a list of examples
(onom.) sound of singing, cheering etc/(phonetic)/(dialect) to chat

sentences.english: The baked apples are spluttering in the oven.
sentences.chinese: 这些烤苹果在烤箱内劈里啪啦地响。

sentences.english: The firecrackers were crackling and spluttering.
Inadvertently, provoke hair with his hand, give rise to cracking and spluttering noise.
sentences.chinese: 不经意间，用手撩动头发，还会产生劈里啪啦的响声。

sentences.english: Rain started to patter on the roof.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶上响起了劈里啪啦的雨点声。

sentences.english: Hailstone are rattling on the window-panes.
sentences.chinese: 冰雹劈里啪啦地敲打着窗玻璃。

sentences.english: We heard the rain spattering on the roof.
sentences.chinese: 我们听见雨点劈里啪啦地打在房顶上。

sentences.english: There were children running all over the place , popping off toy guns.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们到处奔跑，劈里啪啦地放着玩具枪。

sentences.english: Rain was splattering on the roof.
sentences.chinese: 雨劈里啪啦地打在屋顶上。

definition: see 噼裡啪啦|噼里啪啦[pi1 li5 pa1 la1]
(onom.) for crack, slap, clap, clatter etc
child's buttocks (esp. Cantonese)/(onom.) crack, slap, clap, clatter etc
(onom.) sound of a crash/with a crash
loud sound, such as that of thunder or a bomb/to rumble/to roar
